oci_langgraph package

Submodules

oci_langgraph.agent_base module

agent_base.py

Author: L. Saetta

AgentBase class provide a base class to implement a node in the LangGraph graph. The framework will call the invoke() method. This class implement the Template Method Design pattern.

License: Mit

class oci_langgraph.agent_base.AgentBase(agent_name: str, name: str)[source]

Bases: Runnable, ABC

AgentBase class provide a base class to implement a node in the LanGraph graph.

abstractmethod handle_invoke(input, config=None, **kwargs)[source]

Handle the invocation of the agent. This method must be implemented by subclasses.

Parameters:

  • input – The input to the agent.

  • config – The configuration for the agent.

  • kwargs – Additional arguments.

Returns:

The output of the agent.

invoke(input, config=None, **kwargs)[source]

Invoke the agent with the given input and configuration.

Parameters:

  • input – The input to the agent.

  • config – The configuration for the agent.

  • kwargs – Additional arguments.

Returns:

The output of the agent.

oci_langgraph.oracle_apm_transport module

File name: transport.py Author: Luigi Saetta Date last modified: 2025-05-01 Python Version: 3.11

Description:

This code provide the http transport support for integration with OCI APM. It must be used only where we start the trace, at the beginning

Usage:

Import this module into other scripts to use its functions. Example:

…

License:

This code is released under the MIT License.

Warning

This module is in development, may change in future versions.

Bases: object

A class to send encoded Zipkin span data to OCI APM.

is_tracing_enabled()[source]

Check if tracing is enabled.

Returns:

True if tracing is enabled, False otherwise.

oci_langgraph.oracle_checkpoint_saver module

oracle_checkpoint_saver.py

Author: L. Saetta

This module provides the OracleCheckpointSaver class, which implements LangGraph’s BaseCheckpointSaver interface to persist workflow state in an Oracle Database using the oracledb driver.

It is an implementation of:

https://github.com/langchain-ai/langgraph/tree/main/libs/checkpoint

License: Mit

Updates: - (19/04/2025) added connection pooling to improve performance. - (19/04/2025) added creation of the table if it doesn’t exist.

class oci_langgraph.oracle_checkpoint_saver.OracleCheckpointSaver(connect_args, min_connections=1, max_connections=5, table_name='OCI_LANGGRAPH_CHECKPOINTS')[source]

Bases: BaseCheckpointSaver

A checkpoint saver that persists LangGraph workflow state to an Oracle Database.

This class manages the insertion, updating, retrieval, and listing of checkpoints identified by thread_id and checkpoint_id.

connection

Active connection to the Oracle Database.

Type:

oracledb.Connection

cursor

Cursor object for executing SQL statements.

Type:

oracledb.Cursor

async aget_tuple(config: RunnableConfig) → CheckpointTuple | None[source]

Asynchronously retrieves a checkpoint tuple from the database.

Parameters:

config (RunnableConfig) – Configuration specifying thread_id and checkpoint_id.

Returns:

The retrieved checkpoint tuple, or None if not found.

Return type:

Optional[CheckpointTuple]

async alist(config: RunnableConfig | None = None, *, filter: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, before: RunnableConfig | None = None, limit: int | None = None) → AsyncIterator[CheckpointTuple][source]

Asynchronously lists checkpoints that match the given criteria.

Parameters:

  • config (Optional[RunnableConfig], optional) – Base configuration

  • checkpoints. (for filtering)

  • filter (Optional[Dict[str, Any]], optional) – Additional filtering criteria.

  • before (Optional[RunnableConfig], optional) – List checkpoints

  • configuration. (created before this)

  • limit (Optional[int], optional) – Maximum number of checkpoints to return.

Yields:

AsyncIterator[CheckpointTuple] – Asynchronous iterator of matching checkpoint tuples.

async aput(config: RunnableConfig, checkpoint: Checkpoint, metadata: CheckpointMetadata, new_versions: dict[str, str | int | float]) → RunnableConfig[source]

Asynchronously inserts a new checkpoint or updates an existing one in the database.

Parameters:

  • config (RunnableConfig) – Configuration specifying thread_id and checkpoint_id.

  • checkpoint (Checkpoint) – The checkpoint data to store.

  • metadata (CheckpointMetadata) – Additional metadata for the checkpoint.

  • new_versions (ChannelVersions) – New channel versions as of this write.

Returns:

Updated configuration after storing the checkpoint.

Return type:

RunnableConfig

async aput_writes(config: RunnableConfig, writes: Sequence[Tuple[str, Any]], task_id: str, task_path: str = '') → None[source]

Asynchronously stores intermediate writes linked to a checkpoint.

Parameters:

  • config (RunnableConfig) – Configuration specifying thread_id and checkpoint_id.

  • writes (Sequence[Tuple[str, Any]]) – List of writes to store.

  • task_id (str) – Identifier for the task creating the writes.

  • task_path (str, optional) – Path of the task creating the writes.

get_tuple(config: RunnableConfig) → CheckpointTuple | None[source]

Retrieves the most recent or specified checkpoint for a given thread.

If checkpoint_id is provided, retrieves that specific checkpoint. Otherwise, selects the most recent checkpoint based on created_at.

All Decimal values are converted to native int or float.

list(config: RunnableConfig | None = None, *, filter: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, before: RunnableConfig | None = None, limit: int | None = None) → Iterator[CheckpointTuple][source]

Lists checkpoints for a given thread_id, ordered by created_at descending. All Decimal values in state/metadata are converted to int/float.

Parameters:

  • config – Configuration that may contain thread_id.

  • filter – Not used.

  • before – Optional checkpoint_id to filter out newer ones.

  • limit – Optional number of records to return.

put(config: RunnableConfig, checkpoint: Checkpoint, metadata: CheckpointMetadata, new_versions: dict[str, str | int | float]) → RunnableConfig[source]

Inserts a new checkpoint or updates an existing one in the database. Uses created_at to track the order of checkpoints.

put_writes(config: RunnableConfig, writes: Sequence[Tuple[str, Any]], task_id: str, task_path: str = '') → None[source]

Stores intermediate writes linked to a checkpoint.

Parameters:

  • config (RunnableConfig) – Configuration specifying thread_id and checkpoint_id.

  • writes (Sequence[Tuple[str, Any]]) – List of writes to store.

  • task_id (str) – Identifier for the task creating the writes.

  • task_path (str, optional) – Path of the task creating the writes.
